title: Source: Bills fire McDermott after playoff failures
content: The Bills have fired head coach Sean McDermott, a source told ESPN, after the team again failed to reach the Super Bowl, despite a 98-50 record in his nine seasons.

title: Uneven Rams overcome 'bad coaching' in OT win
content: The Rams overcame what Sean McVay called "bad coaching" in Sunday's win over the Bears, using a dominant defensive performance and timely plays to gut out the victory.

title: Stroud on career-worst 4 INTs: 'Let people down'
content: Houston QB C.J. Stroud shouldered the blame after one of the worst outings of his career saw the Texans' season end in a loss to the Patriots.

title: Bears' Williams: Future bright despite painful exit
content: Caleb Williams and the Bears expressed frustration with the way the season abruptly ended, but they left Sunday night with a positive outlook for the future.

title: Pats' D fueled by talk, makes statement vs. Texans
content: Thanks to a swarming defensive performance -- which tied the franchise postseason record with four interceptions -- the Patriots advance to the AFC Championship Game next Sunday against the Broncos.

title: Centurion: Djokovic wins 100th Aussie match
content: Novak Djokovic closed Day 2 at the Australian Open with his 100th win at Melbourne Park. He beat Pedro Martinez in straight sets in a match that marked the start of a record 21st Australian Open and 81st Grand Slam.

title: U bet? CFP spread shifts toward underdog Canes
content: A surge of respected money coming in on Miami over the weekend has caused the CFP title point spread to move toward the underdog Hurricanes. Indiana is now a 7.5-point favorite as of Monday morning.

title: Broncos' AFC title game odds tumble with Nix hurt
content: The Patriots opened as 4.5-point road favorites over the Broncos for the AFC Championship, while the Seahawks opened as 1.5-point home favorites over the Rams for the NFC Championship, according to DraftKings lines.

title: Ayton's perfect game helps L.A. right ship in win
content: Deandre Ayton became the first Lakers player since at least 1977-78 to finish a game with 25 points on 100% shooting with zero turnovers.

title: ✍ NBA midseason grades for all 30 teams
content: Kevin Pelton gives a grade for all 30 teams halfway through the season. Which teams exceeded expectations?

title: Barnwell: The 11 most fascinating plays of the divisional round, and why each mattered
content: Let's sort out Caleb Williams' wild fourth-quarter TD throw, the Broncos' controversial INT, a big Seattle kickoff return TD, a C.J. Stroud pick-six and more.

title: 'Everyone has someone to cheer for': Inside Fernando Mendoza's Miami homecoming
content: Indiana's quarterback has deep roots in South Florida, creating some split loyalties for the title game.

title: Los Angeles prevails in divisional round win over Chicago
content: The Bears had been kings of comeback wins, but the Rams are the ones advancing to the NFC title game.

title: Let's overreact to divisional round games: Pause Stroud's extension talks? Concern about Stafford?
content: Hold off on any new Stroud deals? Matthew Stafford is in a funk? No Super Bowl yet again for Buffalo? Let's make sense of every divisional round game.

title: Chaotic AFCON final an embarrassment to soccer
content: Fan clashes, VAR controversies, missed penalties, a walkout, Senegal's extra time winner - the AFCON final had it all.

title: Man United stun rivals City; Senegal win AFCON amid controversy; Barcelona lose; more
content: What a weekend! Man United stunned their rivals City in a fiery derby, Senegal won AFCON amid controversial scenes, Thomas Frank is on the brink as Spurs boss and Barcelona somehow lost at Real Sociedad.

title: Will Colts, Daniel Jones run it back in 2026?
content: There's mutual interest, but there's also the matter of the QB's recovery from a December torn Achilles.

title: Sizing up the AL Central: What each team still needs to do before spring training
content: There haven't been a lot of headline deals in this division so far, but there's still work left this winter.

title: Which injuries will have the biggest impact on the Olympic hockey tournament?
content: Leo Carlsson, Brayden Point and Seth Jones are among those ailing ahead of Milan Cortina. Plus, what to watch in the NHL this week.

title: 'I just want to do Australia proud': Alex de Minaur on challenges ahead
content: Alex de Minaur talked to ESPN about his home major, his "Best Actor" award and the ongoing challenge of playing Alcaraz and Sinner.

title: Meet 'the special 13': The JMU transfers forming an unlikely Indiana CFP title core
content: Thirteen Dukes players followed Curt Cignetti to become Hoosiers. Those who remain are on the verge of CFB history.

title: Indiana could go 16-0 with a title game win -- but it wouldn't be the first. Meet 1894 Yale
content: Indiana could complete a 16-0 season with a national championship win over Miami on Monday night. But it won't be the first team to accomplish the feat.

title: Chris Gotterup continues rise, opens '26 with Sony win
content: Chris Gotterup opened the new PGA Tour season with three big birdies on the back nine that carried him to a 6-under 64 and a two-shot victory in the Sony Open.

title: Denver advances, but Bo Nix is out: Six questions about where the Broncos go from here
content: The Broncos advanced to the AFC title game but lost their QB to a broken ankle. So what's next for them on their Super Bowl quest?

title: Kevin Stefanski to Falcons: Grading the hire and the impact on Penix
content: Kevin Stefanski didn't have a great record in Cleveland, but he'll have more talent to work with in Atlanta.

title: John Harbaugh to the Giants! Eight questions and a grade for New York's move
content: The 63-year-old has been able to call his own shot in this coaching search and wound up choosing the Giants.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea open to Fernández exit; Madrid, PSG interested
content: Chelsea's Enzo Fernández could be available this summer as Real Madrid and PSG monitor his situation. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Transfer window weekly: Güler to Arsenal? Chelsea squad changes?
content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Natalia Silva, Max Holloway can create UFC chaos immediately in 2026
content: Natalia Silva, Amanda Nunes, Max Holloway and more fighters who can derail UFC championship predictions in 2026.

title: Revanth Reddy lands in Davos to promote Telangana as global investment hub
content: During the four-day conference Mr. Revanth Reddy is scheduled to hold extensive meetings with chief executive officers of global corporations, leading investors and representatives from diverse sectors

title: Kerala’s first ‘work near home’ facility inaugurated in Kottarakkara
content: Govt.’s pioneering initiative, which aims to decentralise the IT sector, can be replicated across all regions of the State, says Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan

title: State govt. will develop resting places of Rayanna's associates, says CM
content: Siddaramaiah was speaking after inaugurating Veer Bhoomi Sangolli Rayanna Museum in Nandagad of Khanapur taluk in Belagavi district

title: Elections to choose 13 APMC members to be held online on February 9
content: For the first time in the State, the elections for the council members will be held online, says Director of Secondary Health

title: Naidu at Davos announces ₹50-crore fund to boost entrepreneurship
content: CM highlights initiatives in A.P. aimed at fostering innovation and entrepreneurship, says government policy promotes the idea of ‘One Family, One Entrepreneur,’ wherein one spouse can focus on business while the other pursues employment

title: Lokesh outlines decentralised growth model with Amaravati as single capital
content: IT and HRD Minister says regional clusters, major investments and South Coast Railway Zone will drive Andhra Pradesh’s rapid development

title: Eight more Lakkundi structures will be declared as protected monument, says Minister
content: This is in addition to the 16 structures already declared as protected monument in Lakkundi village of Gadag district, according to H.K. Patil

title: Round-the-clock AI-enabled call centre on LSGD services
content: Services include resolution of various doubts regarding panchayat and municipality building regulations, panchayat license rules, and civil registration rules like birth, death, marriage.

title: Kollam Vigilance Court to pronounce verdict on Unnikrishnan Potti’s bail on Tuesday
content: Though the court may grant bail to Potti in the case involving the gold theft from Dwarapalakas, he will not be released from jail since he is also an accused in the case of gold theft from the door frame

title: Challenges before Nitin Nabin, as he is poised to take over the BJP
content: The 45-year-old leader has his task cut out, with his immediate challenge being the next round of elections in States including West Bengal, Kerala, Puducherry, Tamil Nadu, and Assam. He may also need to bring in younger leaders to keep the party relevant — without altering its core ideology or base

title: Sexuality education initiative rolled out in colleges
content: Survey held as part of ‘Talking Sex with Project X’ explored issues of consent, responsibility, and self-expression

title: Through Rajendran’s entry, BJP eyeing a breakthrough in Devikulam
content: CPI(M) district secretariat member K.V. Sasi says the majority of voters in the constituency are plantation workers who will not change their long-standing ideology just because of Rajendran’s shift

title: Supreme Court stays Rajasthan High Court order to remove liquor shops within 500 metres of highways
content: The SC Bench observes that while the concerns expressed by the High Court were ‘absolutely genuine’, the sweeping directions merit closer judicial scrutiny

title: Foreign experts conduct sixth review of Polavaram project
content: International team inspects key dam components and reviews construction progress as officials brief them on work status and execution challenges

title: Delhi High Court reserves order on Lalu Yadav's plea to quash FIR in land-for-jobs case
content: In his petition in the high court, Lalu Prasad Yadav has sought quashing of the FIR as well as the three chargesheets filed in 2022, 2023 and 2024 and the consequential orders of cognisance

title: Mysuru–Kushalnagar railway project shelved over low viability
content: The project was originally conceived to provide Kodagu district rail connectivity. However, the proposal faced strong resistance locally

title: Kerala State Film Awards to be presented on January 25
content: The J.C. Daniel Award, the State government’s highest film honour, will be presented to actor Sarada at the event.

title: Piyush Goyal meets U.S. Ambassador Gor, Senator Steve Daines; discusses bilateral issues
content: The meeting is important as India and the U.S. are engaged in negotiating a bilateral trade agreement amidst a steep 50% import duty imposed by the Donald Trump administration on Indian goods since August

title: YSRCP leaders stage protest over Dalit activist’s ‘murder’
content: Protest launched after repeated requests to meet the DGP denied, forcing party leaders to submit their representation to an Additional DGP instead

title: ‘Misconduct’ video: Rights panel orders probe into death of youth
content: The youth hailing from Govindapuram was found dead at his house on January 18 after a video alleging sexual misconduct involving him got circulated on social media

title: Field Ravindranath Dandin in polls to West Graduates Constituency, BJP urged
content: Alumni Association of Kanakadasa Education Committee says he has been playing a key role in addressing issues concerning graduates

title: Nitin Nabin elected BJP president unopposed
content: After a day-long nomination process at BJP headquarters, the five-term MLA from Bihar was the only candidate in the fray; as one of the youngest BJP presidents to date, Nabin is expected to midwife a generational shift in BJP as it looks forward to the next decade or so

title: LDF, UDF brace for a bruising political battle as the 15th Kerala Assembly convenes for its final Budget session on Tuesday
content: The LDF will likely leverage the rape charge against Palakkad MLA Rahul Mamkootathil and the discrepancies in the Youth Congress fund collection drive for Wayanad landslide victims, while the UDF may seek to weaponise the Sabarimala gold theft and the State’s financial situation to take the fight to the ruling coalition

title: Midday meal scheme launched for college students
content: The programme aims to ensure that economically disadvantaged women students do not go hungry during the afternoon

title: T20 WC: Scotland to replace Bangladesh? Fresh updates emerge
content: Scottish cricket officials have said the ICC has not contacted them about replacing Bangladesh at the T20 World Cup, despite speculation. Scotland, the highest-ranked team outside the tournament, would be ready if approached but are not initiating talks out of respect for Bangladesh, whose participation remains uncertain amid venue and political concerns.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: 5 reasons why Cong should dump DMK, join TVK
content: As Tamil Nadu Congress strategizes for the 2026 elections, it's at a crossroads: should it maintain its long-standing alliance with the DMK or consider a fresh partnership with the charismatic actor Vijay's TVK? Tensions within the party flared after the DMK turned down a proposed power-sharing deal, leading to lessons on 'coalition dharma'.

title: Chinese customs block Nvidia H200: Suppliers halt production; customers cancel orders
content: Nvidia faces a significant setback in China as customs officials block H200 AI chip imports, prompting component suppliers to halt production. Despite US approval, Chinese authorities have reportedly implemented a ban, catching Nvidia off guard. Chinese tech giants, pressured to favor domestic alternatives like Huawei's Ascend, are also canceling orders, creating substantial uncertainty for the chipmaker's market entry.

title: Orange is the new Red: Is Trump America's most Left-leaning president?
content: Critics often call him a right-wing white supremacist nationalist and, much like the Holy Roman Empire, none of those descriptors are remotely accurate. He’s not right-wing, not a white supremacist, and not even nationalist. Trump doesn’t care about race at all, not in the way people think. He’s barely nationalist and will always put his own self-interest ahead of the nation’s. And right-wing? He’s the most left-leaning POTUS, so much so that if McCarthy were around today, he would blacklist him.

title: Ind vs NZ: Can Nitish Reddy be Hardik Pandya's backup? Former cricketer gives verdict
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan believes Nitish Kumar Reddy should have featured earlier in the ODI series against New Zealand. Pathan highlighted Reddy's promising batting and bowling performances, suggesting he could be a valuable backup for Hardik Pandya. The youngster's potential to play big shots and bowl at decent speeds impressed Pathan, who advocates for continued management support.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife's donations questioned - What it revealed?
content: MacKenzie Scott's ex-wife, Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

title: 'I chose it out of passion': Google founder Sergey Brin on studying computer science
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin recently shared insights on the evolving value of higher education in the age of AI. He emphasized that passion and curiosity, rather than just credentials, drive success, even as AI capabilities grow. Brin also noted Google's shift towards hiring "self-taught stars" with proven skills over solely relying on traditional degrees.

title: The squeeze play: How BJP is shrinking space for regional parties - decoded
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is strategically shrinking the political space for regional parties across India. Recent election results in Maharashtra, Bihar, and Uttar Pradesh demonstrate the BJP's success in weakening rivals through fragmentation, welfare schemes, and narrative control. While regional parties persist, their ability to translate state power into national influence has significantly diminished.

title: Broncos vs Patriots injury report: Latest on Dobbins, Nix and more
content: The AFC Championship Game between the Denver Broncos and New England Patriots is clouded by significant injuries. Broncos QB Bo Nix is out for the season with an ankle fracture, while RB J.K. Dobbins' return is uncertain. The Patriots are also monitoring CB Carlton Davis's concussion status, with these key player absences potentially deciding the Super Bowl berth.

title: Bill Belichick lands new ESPN role as North Carolina looks ahead after 4–8 season
content: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPN’s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolina’s head coach ended at 4–8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heels’ April 12 spring game.

title: Tom Brady grows wary of past mistakes with Alix Earle amid romance rumors
content: Tom Brady and popular influencer, Alix Earle, turned heads with their romance at the New Year’s Eve party in St. Barth’s. The two were spotted standing close to each other as Alix Earle rubbed Tom Brady’s back. This has sparked chaos among fans as many are excited about their future. But it seems the NFL legend might be “suspicious” of Alix Earle.

title: Roger Federer revisits Australian Open glory with wife Mirka and kids
content: Roger Federer returned to the 2026 Australian Open with his full family and shared emotional memories from Melbourne. The seven-time champion spoke about reliving past wins, watching old clips, and his children playing with his trophy. Federer also played an exhibition match, giving fans another special moment from the tennis legend.

title: Nitin Nabin elected BJP chief unopposed: To take charge tomorrow; PM Modi to attend event
content: Nitin Nabin has been elected unopposed as the national president of the Bharatiya Janata Party, set to formally take charge on January 20. His uncontested election, at 45 years old, signifies a generational leadership shift within the party. The smooth transition highlights the BJP's internal consensus and procedural discipline ahead of future elections.

title: 'Double agent of Israel': Josh Shapiro drops bombshell about Kamala Harris
content: Shapiro writes that he pushed back immediately, calling the question offensive and absurd. What troubled him more than the question itself was what it suggested about the assumptions being made. He wondered whether similar scrutiny was being applied to non-Jewish contenders, or whether he was being treated as a unique risk because of his identity and his outspoken criticism of antisemitism on US college campuses after the October 7 attacks.

title: DJ Moore faces backlash after OT mistake, skips locker room post-playoff exit
content: DJ Moore became a focal point after the Bears’ season ended with an overtime loss to the Rams. A late miscommunication with Caleb Williams led to a costly interception, and Moore was reportedly absent from the locker room during media access. While the duo helped Chicago win the NFC North, the ending raised questions about accountability.

title: A 'golden' bid for dominance: Decoding Trump's Greenland grab; knock-out blow for Russia, China?
content: Donald Trump's renewed focus on Greenland, linked to his 'Golden Dome' missile defence proposal, signals a strategic shift.  This Arctic island is seen as vital for US national security, offering a crucial vantage point against Russia and China.  The ambitious 'Golden Dome' aims for near-invulnerability, sparking global concerns over strategic stability and the militarisation of space.

title: 'Fabricated': K'taka DGP after 'compromising' video goes viral; CM warns of action
content: Karnataka DGP (civil rights enforcement) K Ramachandra Rao is under scrutiny after a video allegedly showing him in a compromising position with women went viral. Rao has rejected the videos as fabricated and false, while Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has vowed strict action and an investigation if guilt is found.

title: Manipur teen who was abducted and gang-raped in 2023 dies as FIR remains pending
content: A 20-year-old Kuki-Zo woman, a survivor of brutal sexual violence during Manipur's ethnic riots, has died from her injuries. Allegedly gang-raped and left for dead in May 2023, her case remains unresolved with no attackers identified. Her death highlights the ongoing suffering and calls for justice for the community.

title: CBSE revises affiliation rules to make student counseling mandatory: Check details here
content: CBSE has revised its affiliation norms to make counseling and career guidance mandatory across all affiliated schools. Approved in November 2025, the changes require trained Counseling & Wellness Teachers and Career Counselors based on student strength. The move aims to strengthen mental health support, ensure professional guidance, and promote holistic student development beyond academics.

title: 5 takeaways from Donald Trump's threatening letter to Norway PM
content: Trump’s line about no longer feeling obligated to think “purely of peace” has been read by some as emotional blackmail over the Nobel Prize. That misses the point. Trump is not rejecting peace as an outcome. He is rejecting peace as a constraint.

title: Raised among doctors and professors, Aman Mokhade leads Vidarbha to VHT glory
content: Vidarbha's Aman Mokhade etched his name in history by scoring 814 runs, becoming the third player to breach the 800-run mark in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Inspired by net sessions with Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni, Mokhade's stellar performance led Vidarbha to their maiden title. His father's unwavering support was crucial in his cricketing journey.

title: 'Curiosity about blondes': Teen boy gropes American woman on Delhi metro
content: An American woman experienced sexual harassment on the Delhi Metro when a teenage boy groped her after she agreed to a photo. The boy's mother defended his actions, claiming he was curious about blondes. The incident left the woman deeply disturbed, and her account has sparked condemnation of the family's response and apologies from other Indians.

title: What the NEET PG 2025 cut-off crash reveals about exam governance
content: Resident doctors' associations are questioning the integrity of NEET PG 2025, citing a series of failures including opaque processes, arbitrary disqualifications, and drastically lowered cut-off scores. This has led to accusations of an institutional collapse, with eligibility decoupled from performance and merit diluted, eroding public trust in the medical profession.

title: 'Welcome brother': PM Modi, UAE prez ride in same car; what's on agenda
content: UAE resident Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan received a special welcome from Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi for a high-level visit. The leaders are set to discuss advancing the India-UAE Comprehensive Strategic Partnership and regional issues, building on recent high-level exchanges and strong bilateral ties.

title: Khabib Nurmagomedov net worth timeline: How UFC legend built wealth (2016–26)
content: Khabib Nurmagomedov went from a quiet fighter in Dagestan to one of the biggest stars in UFC history. He retired in 2020 with a perfect 29–0 record and massive fight earnings. After leaving the cage, he grew his wealth through coaching, MMA promotions, and business projects. By 2025–2026, his net worth sits in the tens of millions, built from smart moves beyond fighting.

title: Neha Kakkar announces break from work after Candy Shop backlash
content: Neha Kakkar announced a break from work, relationships, and public life after Candy Shop—her song with brother Tony Kakkar—faced massive online trolling for "vulgar" lyrics and "cringe" K-pop vibes. Released Dec 15, 2025, it hit 23M YouTube views amid backlash. She seeks privacy, no cameras.

title: PSL adopts IPL-style auction; scraps draft system to 'increase transparency'
content: The Pakistan Super League will adopt a player auction system from its 11th season, mirroring the Indian Premier League's model. This change, along with an increased franchise purse to USD 1.6 million, aims to boost transparency and competitive balance. Franchises can now retain a maximum of four players, with new teams getting pre-auction picks.

title: Frantic calls, 90-min fight: How Noida techie battled death in open pit; what autopsy reveals
content: A software engineer tragically drowned in a deep, water-filled pit after his SUV crashed in dense fog. Despite desperate attempts to signal for help, rescue efforts were hampered by poor visibility and the pit's depth. An FIR has been filed against the builders for negligence, highlighting a lack of safety measures at the construction site.

title: Unnao rape: Delhi HC rejects Kuldeep Sengar's plea to suspend 10-year jail term
content: The Delhi High Court will decide today on former BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar's plea to suspend his sentence in the Unnao custodial death case. Sengar, serving a 10-year term for the father's death and a life sentence for rape, has argued he's served nearly nine years.

title: IMF lifts India’s 2025 growth forecast to 7.3%; global resilience offset tariff shocks
content: The IMF has upgraded India's 2025 growth outlook to 7.3%, citing strong corporate earnings and economic momentum. Global growth is projected to hold steady at 3.3% this year, with resilience driven by AI investment and easing trade tensions. However, risks remain from AI sector valuations and escalating geopolitical uncertainties.

title: ICC deadline puts Bangladesh T20 WC spot under threat; this team next in line
content: Bangladesh's participation in the T20 World Cup remains uncertain as the ICC set a January 21 deadline for confirmation. Citing security concerns, the Bangladesh Cricket Board requested matches be moved to Sri Lanka, with Scotland potentially replacing them if they withdraw. Discussions are ongoing, with a group swap also considered.

title: Dreams do come true: How Stephen Curry created a lifetime memory for a young NBA fan
content: During a recent game against the Hornets, Stephen Curry surprised a young fan by inviting him onto the court to participate in his pre-game warmup. The fan successfully delivered a high-bounce pass to Curry, creating a viral moment. This heartwarming interaction further solidifies Curry's reputation for connecting with his fans, adding to his legacy of fan-first gestures.

title: Karachi Shopping Mall Fire Death Count Hits 21, Dozens Still Missing
content: The death count from a major fire at a shopping mall in Pakistan's Karachi city rose to 21 on Monday, while around 65 people remain missing, officials said.

title: Video of Indians Chanting "Jai Maharashtra" Slogans in Paris Sparks Backlash
content: A viral video showing a group of Indian men chanting slogans like Jai Maharashtra, Jai Shiv Sena and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj ki Jai near a street performer in Paris has sparked outrage on social media over public conduct.

title: 'Held For 2 Hours, Money Taken': Rajasthan School Teams' Manipur Video Viral
content: These students travelled by train and car from the northwestern desert corner of the country to a border state far away in the northeast to participate in a national school sports championship, and they returned home victorious.

title: UAE President's 3-Hour India Visit And PM Modi's Special Gesture
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today welcomed the UAE's President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan in Delhi and shared visuals of the gesture, where both leaders were seen hugging.

title: 7 Killed, 13 Injured In Blast In Afghanistan's Kabul: Report
content: Several people were killed in a blast in Afghan capital Kabul's Shahr-e-Naw area, the Taliban interior ministry said on Monday.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics Could Wipe Out 3,000 Ice Rinks Worth of Snow: Report
content: The Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics, scheduled to take place from February 6 to 22, 2026, in northern Italy, face criticism over their climate impact, particularly due to sponsorship deals with high-carbon companies, according to a new report.

title: Big Action In Techie Drowning Case: Top Noida Official Removed, SIT Formed
content: Following the death of a 27-year-old software engineer whose car plunged into a water-filled pit at a construction site in Noida's Sector 150, the Noida Authority CEO M Lokesh has been removed from his post.

title: Special Investigation Team Formed To Probe Noida Techie's Drowning, Report In 5 Days
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has formed a special investigation team (SIT) to look into the death of a Noida techie after his car fell into a pit at a construction site. The SIT will give a report in five days.

title: How 260 Cows Were Slaughtered 2 Km From State Secretariat In Madhya Pradesh
content: Madhya Pradesh has long claimed to have the toughest cow-protection laws in India, with a ban on cow slaughter in place since 2004. The current 2024-25 period was even officially declared the "Cow Protection Year."

title: G-Zero World Is Here: Ian Bremmer To NDTV In Davos Warning
content: India is no longer on the fool around and find out side of global power. According to Bremmer, it now sits in what he calls the TACO spectrum, short for Trump Always Chickens Out.

title: New Delhi World Book Fair 2026 Sees 20% Rise In Footfall With Free Entry
content: The 53rd edition of the New Delhi World Book Fair (NDWBF) concluded on Sunday with a 20 per cent increase in footfall.

title: Japan PM Sanae Takaichi Seeks Stronger Mandate, Calls Snap Election On Feb 8
content: Sanae Takaichi, a staunch conservative who admires Margaret Thatcher, became Japan's first woman prime minister in October, though she has shown little appetite for framing her leadership around gender.

title: 'E Shinde Is Afraid His Corporators Will Jump Sides': Congress MP
content: Mumbai Congress President Varsha Gaikwad has come out swinging against Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, accusing the ruling Mahayuti of bringing "low-level resort politics" to the city's civic body for the first time in history.

title: Foreign Envoys Flock To Meet BNP Chief Tarique Rahman Ahead of Polls
content: Aspiring Prime Minister and political heavyweight Tarique Rahman, Chairman of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP), has been meeting with foreign diplomats ahead of the national elections scheduled in a month.

title: From Beginnings To Losing Power: All About Japan's Liberal Democratic Party
content: Japan's Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) is a huge electoral machine that has governed the nation for all but four years since its founding 70 years ago.

title: All You Need To Know About Europe's Deadliest Train Disasters Since 2000
content: The collision late on Sunday between two high-speed trains in southern Spain which has killed at least 39 people is the sixth worst rail accident in Europe since 2000.

title: Israel Army Says Struck Terror Infrastructure Used By Hezbollah In Lebanon
content: Israel's army said it carried out several strikes against Hezbollah infrastructure in southern Lebanon on Monday, despite Lebanon this month announcing progress in disarming the militia.

title: Donald Trump Wants Greenland For Ego, Not Security: Ian Bremmer To NDTV
content: The bigger issue, Bremmer said, is that "his closest advisers are reluctant to tell him hes making a big mistake. And that can get you into trouble."

title: Jaish Terrorist Hideout Located At Altitude Of 12,000 Feet Busted In J&K
content: Security forces have achieved a significant breakthrough in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar after busting an underground hideout of Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorists located at an altitude of 12,000 feet in the Singhpora area of Chhatroo.

title: Chhattisgarh Mid-Day Meal Cooks, Earning Rs 66 A Day, Protest For Wage Hike
content: It's been 22 days since thousands of mid-day meal cooks, mostly women, have been protesting in Chhattisgarh capital Raipur, demanding a hike in their daily wages from Rs 66 to over Rs 400.

title: A.P.’s fiscal stress deepening amid high revenue deficit for three years: CAG report
content: Data from the Comptroller and Auditor General highlights a troubling pattern of rising committed expenditure, weak non-tax revenues, and subdued capital spending

title: RBI proposes linking BRICS' digital currencies, sources say
content: Reserve ‌Bank of India (RBI) has recommended to the government that a proposal connecting the central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) be included ​on the agenda for the 2026 BRICS summit

title: BJP Scheduled Castes Morcha protests Dharwad honour killing, seeks action
content: Stating that the gruesome incident has exposed the failure of the govt. to protect inter-caste couples, it demands the arrest of all the accused

title: Over 1,000 students receive free laptops in Cuddalore
content: Earlier, Minister for Agriculture and Farmer’s Welfare M.R.K. Panneerselvam, accompanied by Collector Sibi Adhithya Senthil Kumar, laid the foundation stone for upgradation of the 33 KV sub-station

title: NIMHANS-type healthcare facility to come up in Mysuru
content: The facility is planned in Varuna assembly constituency for ₹100 crore; the necessary land has been transferred to Mysore Medical College and Research Institute (MMCRI) to start the works

title: YSRCP misrule ruined Revenue Department, alleges Farooq
content: Law Minister says 90% of public petitions relate to land grabbing and Section 22A disputes during the 2019–24 regime, accuses Jagan of claiming credit for TDP projects

title: Remarks about Satheesan misrepresented by media: NSS general secretary
content: He says the core issue is NSS-SNDP Yogam unity and it is unfair to assign unnecessary political significance to anyone in this context, especially with elections approaching

title: NKSSIA to host Vendor Development Programme in Hubballi tomorrow
content: It aims at providing a platform for industrialists, entrepreneurs and MSMEs in North Karnataka to interact with officials of PSUs

title: Forest Department plans bio-shields to protect three Pudukottai coastal villages from natural calamities
content: As many as 19,250 mangrove seedlings are being raised under the TN-SHORE Project to protect the shoreline  at three coastal villages; planting to be carried out by August before the onset of the NE monsoon

title: KSEB unions slam findings of vigilance raids
content: The organisations have accused the Vigilance and Anti-Corruption Bureau of showing undue haste in portraying KSEB employees as corrupt following the ‘Operation Short Circuit’ inspections in KSEB offices on January 16.

title: Writer Imayam thanks Stalin for instituting Semmozhi Literary Award
content: On January 8, he had written to the Chief Minister requesting the establishment of an award similar to the Jnanpith Award to honour writers at the national level

title: 94% paddy payments credited within 24 hours, Kharif procurement in final stage: Civil Supplies Minister
content: Nadendla Manohar says ₹9,890 crore paid to 6.83 lakh farmers so far, preparations begin for Rabi procurement to avoid Kharif lapses

title: IMPACT-VIP meet puts focus on safe medicine use for visually impaired
content: The session brings together government, international partners and representatives of the visually-impaired community

title: Value addition, industry tie-ups can boost farm growth: MIA
content: Farmers are the backbone of the country, while industries act as its supporting pillars, says Suresh Kumar Jain

title: You cannot blackmail the bench too, Madras High Court judge tells ‘Savukku’ Shankar
content: Justice P. Velmurugan of Madras High Court refuses to accede to the YouTuber’s plea to recuse from hearing a plea to cancel the interim bail granted to him by another Bench in December

title: Residents in coastal hamlet in Nagapattinam district battle scarcity with underground cement water tanks
content: Incursion of saline water in borewells and inadequate piped water supply has left several fisher families in the coastal village of Keechankuppam at the mercy of private water suppliers

title: UDF will have a vision plan to address unemployment in Kerala once voted to power, says Rahul Gandhi
content: The people of Kerala should be able to do in the State itself the jobs they do abroad, says Congress leader

title: Congress alleges bid to purge voters in Rajasthan through SIR, seeks forensic probe
content: Citing data from the EC’s website, Congress leader Govind Singh Dotasra claims that the BJP, through 937 booth-level agents, sought the deletion of 5,694 names and the addition of 211, while the Congress, through 110 agents, applied to add 185 names and delete two

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: UAE President Al Nahyan arrives in India
content: Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan will be in the national capital for less than two hours, according to his schedule released by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA)

title: In Focus Podcast | ‘Jana Nayagan’ vs. the CBFC: What goes behind censoring 720 hours of film?
content: Vijay’s farewell film, Jana Nayagan, faces a last-minute Revising Committee review, raising “political conspiracy” claims. Aroon Deep joins us on In Focus to explore film censorship.

title: Spanish train collision: EAM Jaishankar expresses grief
content: The evening train between Malaga and Madrid went off the rails near Cordoba and slammed into a train coming from Madrid to Huelva, according to a rail operator

title: Kannur cyber police nab Punjab man for duping doctor of ₹10.5 lakh in ‘digital arrest’ scam
content: The accused, identified as Jeevan Ram, a native of Ludhiana, was arrested from a remote village following a high-risk operation

title: CM Stalin lays foundation stone for Mamallan reservoir, proposed as Chennai’s sixth drinking water source
content: The reservoir would have an annual storage capacity of 2.25 tmcft when filled twice and a potential to supply 170 million litres a day (mld) to Chennai

title: NHL trade grades: Why the Rasmus Andersson swap could be a big win for both teams
content: the Calgary Flames traded defenseman Rasmus Andersson to the Vegas Golden Knights for a package that included defenseman Zach Whitecloud . Previously, the Vancouver Canucks traded Quinn Hughes to the Minnesota Wild in exchange for Zeev Buium , Marco Rossi , Liam Ohgren and a 2026 first-round pick .

title: Will Heisman-winning QB Fernando Mendoza fall victim to the national title curse?
content: the 2025 Heisman Trophy is awarded to the players regarded as the best in all of college football . this year's winner helped carry his team to the national championship game . the only major college program to achieve the feat was Yale ... in 1894 .

title: Nick Foles' message to Broncos fans: Pats 'struggle against backup QBs'
content: the Broncos will face the new England Patriots in next Sunday's AFC Championship game . backup quarterback Jarrett Stidham is out for the rest of the playoffs . he hasn't started a game since the final two of the 2023 season .

title: Title game confidential: Scouts and coaches break down Miami-Indiana
content: Indiana is on the cusp of capping off one of the most dramatic program U-turns in college football history . the no. 1 Hoosiers are undefeated, play cleaner football than anyone in the power conferences . they haven't finished in the top five since 1967 .

title: AL West update: Will M's spend more? Will Astros make a deal?
content: the biggest contract handed out in the American League West occurred on Nov. 17, a mere two weeks into the offseason . it wasn't from the Houston Astros , who claimed seven division titles and two world Series championships from 2017 to 2024 . the Seattle Mariners authored one of their greatest seasons in 2025 .

title: The AFC North: 1 coach, 2 (?) starting QBs, many questions
content: new coach will have to cultivate a working relationship with lamar Jackson . owner Steve Bisciotti learned that Mike Tomlin had stepped down as the Pittsburgh Steelers ' head coach . this has become one of the most surprising offseasons in the AFC North because of the uncharacteristic turnover .

title: Patriots hold off Texans in turnover-filled divisional round playoff game
content: the new England Patriots beat texans 28-16 in a divisional round playoff game . the Patriots' defense forced five turnovers, intercepting Texans quarterback C.J. Stroud four times . new England quarterback Drake Maye overcame three turnovers to help the no. 2 seed advance .

title: Why clamor for Man United, Tottenham 'DNA' makes no sense
content: football DNA is a term that seems to be used only when a manager/head coach is struggling and the supporters and former players boil their difficulties down tainted . the term is called football DNA . it is the first term that has been used to describe a football team's culture .

title: 10 NBA teams that could swing trade season's final 20 days
content: the league's three-week sprint to the Feb. 5 trade deadline is here . many contenders are still deciding on a direction . a weekly trip around the Association focuses on those teams trying to add to their rosters .

title: 'It shaped my DNA': The very Miami story of Mario Cristobal
content: new: "i feel the obligation to get Miami right. call it a labor of love. I'm going to work myself to the grave to get this done," he says . new: the team's goal is to restore them to their rightful spot atop the college football world . the team will play in the cFP national championship on tuesday .

title: First look at the NFL's conference title games
content: the Broncos will host the Patriots in the aFC on Jan. 25 . the Seahawks will face the Rams . we asked our NFL Nation reporters to pick one thing we learned about the teams they cover during the divisional round .
